description:
The Construction of  Sewage Treatment Plant and Mian Pressure Line in Khan Younis in the Gaza Strip . 
The project aims at protecting the public health and improving the environmental conditions of Khan Younis residents.

subproject.corporate outcome: Expansion and access to financial services for the poor, employment and income generation and access to markets, goods and services.
subproject.description:
Project Brief Description: 
During last quarter of 2005, UNDP/PAPP has been entrusted by the Government of Japan with a total grant of USD14,830,000 for the construction of Sewage Treatment Plant and inlet Main Pressure Pipeline in Khan Younis Governorate  in the Gaza Strip; " KY WWTP".

Project Objectives:
§ Constructing a waste water treatment plant to serve Khan Younis Governorate’s residents.  
§ Protecting the public health and improving the environmental conditions in Khan Younis Governorate, particularly Khan Younis City, for the purpose of enhancing residents' quality of life and simulating investment and economic development. 
§ Protecting the limited ground water resources and providing new water source of treated effluent to ultimately be used for agricultural purposes.
§ Creating the maximum number of job opportunities for unemployment of the Palestinian workers in the area of khan Younis during the construction phase.

The Project’s strategic plan developed to design an extendable waste water treatment plant to serve the population of Khan Younis Governorate up to the year 2025, while constructing it into two Phases reference to available resources and demand. The design figures of KY WWTP, Phase I, are based on the flow of 26,600 cubic meters per day and load estimates for the year 2018, while the design figures Phase II are based on the flow of 44,900 cubic meters per day and load estimates for the year 2025. 
Effluent and emergency pressure pipeline will be constructed to discharge the treated effluent to the infiltration basins or the sea shore in case of emergency situation with a total length of 18.6 km. Through the infiltration basins; the treated effluent will be recharged to the ground water aquifer to enhancing it and to ultimately be used for agricultural purposes.
The proposed KY WWTP, Phase 1, is envisaged to be constructed and operational in by 2014-2015.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Construction of TreatmentPlant

title: Construction of Sewage Treatment Plant in Khan Younis
